adventures.title: Adventures
adventures.subtitle: Exploring the world, one adventure at a time.

panels.title: Grand Europe Tour
panels.description: A sweeping first look at Europe — the Eiffel Tower and Louvre in Paris, the Gothic cathedral of Cologne, the art and history of Berlin, and the ancient grandeur of the Colosseum in Rome.

panels.title: Hawaii: Maui
panels.description: Parasailing over Lahaina's crystal-clear waters and watching the sunrise from the summit of Haleakalā — a dormant volcanic crater soaring over 10,000 feet above sea level.

panels.title: Catalina Island
panels.description: Snorkeling through crystal-clear kelp forests, camping on the island's rugged coastal shores, and exploring the unique landscape of California's island gem off the coast of Los Angeles.

panels.title: Europe: Ireland & Central Europe
panels.description: Dublin's historic pubs and cobblestone lanes, Amsterdam's iconic canals, Berlin's East Side Gallery, Prague's fairytale old town, Munich's Marienplatz — and the dramatic basalt columns of Giant's Causeway in Northern Ireland.

panels.title: Disneyland Holiday
panels.description: Disneyland dressed for the holidays — festive park decorations, classic rides, and Sleeping Beauty's castle lit up for Christmas.

panels.title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon
panels.description: Standing beneath General Sherman — the world's largest tree by volume — exploring the ancient Grant Grove, and hiking deep into the High Sierra backcountry.

image.alt: General Sherman Tree, Sequoia National Park

panels.title: Redwood National Park
panels.description: Wandering through ancient old-growth groves, hiking coastal trails above the Pacific, and camping along wild river corridors in the world's tallest forest.

panels.title: Washington D.C.
panels.description: The National Mall in fall color, tours of the Capitol, world-class Smithsonian museums, and the iconic cherry blossoms lining the Tidal Basin near the Lincoln Memorial.

panels.title: Utah & Arizona Loop
panels.description: Standing on the rim of the Grand Canyon, scrambling through Arches National Park's iconic sandstone fins, and exploring the red rock adventure hub of Moab.

panels.title: Northern Rockies: Wyoming & Montana
panels.description: Watching Old Faithful erupt at Yellowstone, camping beneath the jagged peaks of the Grand Teton, and exploring the frontier towns of Billings and Bozeman.

image.alt: Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks

panels.title: Lake Tahoe
panels.description: Snow-capped peaks reflected in the impossibly blue waters of Lake Tahoe, with sweeping alpine lake vistas and a summer visit to catch a spectacular drone light show over the water.

panels.title: Chicago
panels.description: Cloud Gate's mirrored reflection of the Chicago skyline in Millennium Park, the Gothic architecture of the University of Chicago campus, and the bold urban grid of one of America's great cities.

panels.title: High Sierra Loop
panels.description: Summiting Half Dome in Yosemite, returning to Sequoia & Kings Canyon, and venturing into the White Mountains to walk among the ancient bristlecone pines — some of the oldest living organisms on Earth.

panels.title: New York City
panels.description: Manhattan's iconic skyline from the High Line and the Empire State Building, a fall walk through Central Park's changing leaves, and the electric energy of the city's classic landmarks.

panels.title: Rocky Mountain National Park
panels.description: Snowshoeing through Rocky Mountain's quiet winter wilderness, returning for the spring thaw as alpine meadows open up, and taking in the sweeping summer peaks above 12,000 feet.

panels.title: Europe: Spain & Portugal
panels.description: The Alhambra's intricate Moorish fortress at dusk, Seville's towering cathedral, the fairy-tale palaces of Sintra, Lisbon's trams and tiled facades, and Porto's scenic riverfront wine culture.

panels.title: Southwest Parks Mega-Trip
panels.description: Saguaro's forests of towering cacti at golden hour, White Sands' blinding gypsum dunes, Carlsbad Caverns' vast underground chambers, Guadalupe Mountains' limestone ridge, and Big Bend's rugged desert canyons and dark skies.

image.alt: Big Bend National Park, Southwest Parks Mega-Trip

panels.title: Japan: Deep Dive
panels.description: Tokyo's electric energy and neon-lit neighborhoods, Kyoto's ancient Shinto shrines tucked in forested hillsides, the haunting and profound Hiroshima Peace Memorial, and Nara's sacred freely-roaming deer.

panels.title: Mexico: Cultural History
panels.description: Exploring the ancient pyramid buried beneath the Great Pyramid of Cholula and the layered colonial history of San Andrés, followed by a horseback ride through the mountain valleys around Texmelucan.

panels.title: What's Next?
panels.description: Always planning the next adventure.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.subtitle: Showcasing my expertise in geospatial analysis and custom development solutions.

items.title: Temporal NDVI Study of Man-Made Forests
items.description: Comprehensive term poster project investigating China's Great Green Wall program to track land use changes, assess new forest health, and analyze weather changes in the Gobi Desert from 2000 to 2022. Employed custom R code to process Landsat imagery into NDVI data from key research zones to derive forest growth areas and relative health of the forests.

image.alt: Temporal NDVI Study Research Project Poster
image.caption: Temporal NDVI Study - China's Great Green Wall Program

additionalImages.alt: Temporal NDVI Study of Man-Made Forests Analysis
additionalImages.caption: Detailed analysis of forest growth patterns and NDVI changes over time

items.title: Santa Barbara Wildfire Analysis
items.description: Used Python to run a supervised classification of Landsat imagery of the Santa Barbara area across 2007, 2008, and 2009 to study the effects of the Jesusita and Gap fires on local vegetation and analyze rates of regrowth. Mapped results using QGIS and associated Landsat imagery bands.

image.caption: Wildfire impact analysis and vegetation regrowth patterns

additionalImages.caption: False color composite analysis of the Santa Barbara area

items.title: Study of Native California Bird Habitat Area Being Lost to Wildfire
items.description: Compiled a decade by decade analysis of wildfire damage to the habitats of the California Condor and Great Gray Owl. Took the CalFIRE historic fire database back to 1900 and color-coded each fire area by decade and clipped the results to the boundaries of the known habitats of both birds of study.

items.title: Agricultural Land Classification
items.description: Supervised classification analysis of farmland areas using remote sensing techniques to identify and map agricultural land use patterns and crop distribution.

image.caption: Farmland classification and agricultural land use mapping

items.title: DGA Transcriber
items.description: Comprehensive Python-based transcription tool with 490+ functions that saves the company $15,000 annually. Built for a Little Hammer Labs customer, featuring open source AI model integration, advanced audio processing, and automated transcription workflows to streamline document creation and data processing.

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Geospatial analyst, tool builder, and avid explorer — based in San Diego.

headshot.alt: Ryan Little at Big Bend National Park
headshot.caption: Big Bend National Park

sections.title: Background
content: Geography has been part of how I read the world since growing up in San Diego — desert to the east, mountains to the north, ocean to the west.

I studied it at UC Santa Barbara, earning a B.A. in Geography with an emphasis in GIS and Remote Sensing. Strong coursework including a three-quarter Remote Sensing sequence and a graduate-level course in Optimization Methods in Geographic Problems, finishing with a 3.5 major GPA.

sections.title: Professional
content: Quality Control Geospatial Analyst at CACI, Inc., supporting geospatial production on government defense contracts — remote, from San Diego.

My work centers on validating spatial data across multi-source geodatabases, resolving conflation discrepancies, and reviewing final deliverables before they reach the client. I also run a mentorship group and weekly team gathering to keep collaboration and morale strong across a distributed team.

image.caption: Remote sensing analysis — water feature mapping

sections.title: Building
content: In 2025 I co-founded Little Hammer Labs with a lifelong friend, where I serve as CTO. We build custom AI-powered tools for clients in forensic architecture and property management.

Our main product takes voice notes recorded during on-site inspections, transcribes them with a locally run Whisper model, runs the output through a custom domain-specific dictionary, and delivers formatted reports ready to hand to the client.
Managing local LLM infrastructure and a full development stack from scratch has been the most clarifying work I've done.

sections.title: Skills
content: Programming: Python, R and RStudio, SQL, Mosel, HTML & CSS, JavaScript
GIS Tools: ArcGIS Pro, ArcMap, ArcGIS Online, QGIS, Microsoft Office Suite
Proficiencies: Remote Sensing, Spatial Databases, Spatial Analysis, Data Visualization, Quality Control & Assurance

sections.title: Outside of Work
content: Avid hiker and traveler — 12 countries and counting, with a strong preference for national parks and places that require some effort to reach.
Also into soccer, building computers, server tinkering, and web development.
